doc.title: Technical Specification: Epic 2 - Model Data Management & Admin CRUD
doc.snippet: Epic 2 extends Hexagonal Architecture with admin use case layer. Application Layer adds AdminModelService, AdminBenchmarkService, AdminAuthService, DataQualityService, AuditLogService. Presentation Layer implements React admin panel components: AdminLayout with sidebar navigation, AdminHeader with user dropdown, AdminSidebar with menu items.

doc.title: Technical Specification: Epic 2
doc.section: User Experience - Responsive admin layout with sidebar navigation
doc.snippet: Admin layout provides sidebar navigation, search/filter in model lists, confirmation dialogs for destructive operations, success/error messaging, dashboard with data quality metrics. Responsive design works on desktop and tablet.

doc.title: Solution Architecture Document
doc.snippet: React 18+ SPA with component-based architecture. Layout pattern: Master-detail with responsive behavior. TailwindCSS for styling. Lucide React for icons. React Router for nested routing.

doc.title: llm-token-price UX/UI Specification
doc.snippet: Admin interfaces target technical users (administrators). Desktop-first design with sidebar navigation. Component hierarchy emphasizes clarity and immediate feedback. Color scheme: Neutral grays for sidebars, white content areas.

doc.title: Story 2.1: Admin Panel Authentication
doc.snippet: Protected routes use ProtectedRoute wrapper component. Pattern: Route wraps AdminLayout with ProtectedRoute. Authentication checked via useAuthStore. User info includes username for display in header.

artifact.reason: Existing public layout component - reference pattern for AdminLayout structure (Header/Main/Footer pattern with flex-col container)
Completed in Story 2.1 - wraps admin routes to enforce authentication. AdminLayout will be nested inside ProtectedRoute.
Zustand auth store from Story 2.1 - provides user.username for header display and clearAuth() for logout button
Auth hook from Story 2.1 - provides logout() function for admin header logout button
Existing placeholder admin dashboard - currently has inline header with logout. Will be refactored to use AdminLayout component in Story 2.2
App routing configuration - currently has single /admin route. Story 2.2 will add nested routing for /admin/dashboard, /admin/models, /admin/benchmarks

architectural.constraint: Component must follow React functional component pattern with TypeScript strict mode
Use TailwindCSS utility classes only - no CSS modules or styled-components
AdminLayout uses children prop pattern for content slot rendering (same as public Layout)
Sidebar navigation must use React Router NavLink for active state management
All components must be in apps/web/src/components/ following domain-based organization

design.constraint: Color scheme: Neutral grays (slate-*) for sidebar, white (#ffffff) for content area
Spacing: Consistent padding-4, gap-6 as per TailwindCSS design system
Icons: Lucide React only (LayoutDashboard, Database, BarChart, LogOut icons)
Responsive breakpoints: Desktop lg: (1024px+), Tablet md: (768-1024px), Mobile <md (<768px)
Desktop: Sidebar always visible. Tablet/Mobile: Collapsible drawer sidebar

routing.constraint: Admin routes must use nested routing pattern: /admin wraps all sub-routes
/admin root redirects to /admin/dashboard using Navigate component
All admin routes wrapped with ProtectedRoute component from Story 2.1
Outlet component renders child routes in AdminLayout main content area

testing.constraint: Component tests using Vitest + React Testing Library
Test sidebar navigation active state highlighting
Test responsive behavior (sidebar collapse on mobile breakpoint)
Test logout button triggers auth service logout method

interface.name: Admin Routes Configuration
interface.signature: <Route path="/admin" element={<ProtectedRoute><AdminLayout /></ProtectedRoute>}> <Route index element={<Navigate to="dashboard" replace />} /> <Route path="dashboard" element={<AdminDashboardPage />} /> <Route path="models" element={<AdminModelsPage />} /> <Route path="benchmarks" element={<AdminBenchmarksPage />} /> </Route>

interface.name: useAuth Hook (from Story 2.1)
interface.signature: interface UseAuthReturn { user: User | null isAuthenticated: boolean login: (username: string, password: string) => Promise<void> logout: () => Promise<void> isLoading: boolean error: string | null }

tests.standards: Epic 1 established comprehensive testing infrastructure: - Frontend: Vitest + React Testing Library for component tests - Test files co-located: ComponentName.test.tsx next to ComponentName.tsx - Coverage target: 70%+ overall, focusing on user interactions and state management - Testing pyramid: 70% unit, 25% integration, 5% E2E - E2E: Playwright for critical user flows (defer full admin flow to Story 2.3)
